intro: Aconogonon coriarium subsp. bucharicum, commonly known as the Bukharan acanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, violet to purple bracts. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. It produces small, green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is known for its resilience to drought conditions. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
